page.title: 02THE BEACH
page.content: The beach at Milford on Sea is mainly shingle but at low tide there is some sand. We have a big wall because when the Solent gets rough it used to push the shingle onto the road. Futher along the beach it gets wider but in the next few years I think it will be pushed along to the spit. The spit is about two miles long , at the end of it there is a castle called Hurst castle. They had to put bolders in to make the spit stronger. In the winter the sea gets over the wall and floods part of the village.
